result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Not guilty plea entered by counsel and trial reserved.

Prosecuting attorney Samuel Thomas Berg in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Victor D Bernal Arreola in court.  Attorney Steven C. Spear in court for Victor D Bernal Arreola. Matter was scheduled for a preliminary hearing but the defendant wishes to waive his right to a preliminary hearing.  Response by Counsel and defendant to Court's questions.  Court finds defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily waives his right to a preliminary hearing and binds the defendant over. Information will mirror complaint. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for August 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.

records.addlTxt:
Adjustment Number: 22A 196857,
Payable Number: 265562,
Receipt Number: 22R 012429,
Amount: $20.00
Original Warrant filed with the court.
Signed bond filed with the court.

Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Any prescribed medication is to be taken within the terms / limits of the prescription. Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH CI #1257 IF KNOWN TO DEFENDANT. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Prosecuting attorney James T. Sempf in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Victor D Bernal Arreola in court, in custody by video. Attorney Steven Spear appeared specially. Interpreter St John previously sworn. Warrant was issued then State sent summons 3 days after warrant was signed. Minutes filed.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Prosecuting attorney James T. Sempf in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Victor D Bernal Arreola in court. Defendant needs Spanish interpreter. Active warrant, placed on the 1:15 call. Minutes filed.
